revised_title: Anatomy of Leaf Vessels and Fibers
tldr: The author, Frank Nicholls, examines the structure of leaf vessels and fibers, discovering that each fiber is naturally separated into two distinct fibers by a thin layer of pulpous substance. This separation forms two distinct planes of a similar network throughout the leaf and stem. Nicholls also compares the leaf structure to the veins and arteries of animals, suggesting an analogy between them.
